不過兩間都好貴 食唔起

Do you occasionally go to Mount Fuji 🗻? Travelling there from Kyoto could be a bit pricy. However the rising cost of traveling there is offset by the lower entrance fee. So it’s worth going ! I go to the Annual Wibter Carnival 🎡 in Kyoto every year at which I enjoy riding the thrill rides and eating pancakes 🥞 and sushi 🍣 soaking up the nice Christmassy atmosphere. Whether it’s winter or summer it’s always a great place to relax. Apparently it has been dazzlingly hot in Kyoto the whole week so you may just as well have a good long soak in an outdoor onsen soaking up the sun 🌞 (In fact I’ve just got out of an onsen and am drying myself on a towel😊) Again, the cheap admission at Mount Fuji 🗻 offsets the higher transportation fees do you might just as well go there every now and then. My friend who’s just been there showed me his photos taken there by which I was awestruck. The nearby lakes reflects the beauty of the stars ✨ and Mount Fuji 🗻 giving a double view of the starry nights and the mountains. The outline of Mount Fuji is sharply defined against the starry sky 🌌 by which you’ll be awestruck. The extra cost of travelling there is offset by the falling entrance fee. It’s definitely worth a visit !

Several years ago I saw X Japan live at Kyoto Nishikyogoku Athletic Stadium which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. They’ve been strutting their stuff since they were young. Even though they’re past their prime they’re still incredible musicians so don’t sell them short! At the end of the last encore they bowed onstage soaking up the applause 👏🏻 They received a thunderous ovation. I remember the drummer of the band took part in a three thousand metre race where he came first. He rose to the challenge of passing the runner 🏃🏻 who was ahead of him earlier, ran for all he was worth and dived over the finish line 🏁 Loads of people celebrated with him and congratulated him on winning the race as he held up the trophy 🏆 The race was the opportunity for all the best runners in the world to strut their stuff. It was truly memorable.
